bibl.title: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, August 17, 1953

div1.p: Rojas writes that she would like Hench to receive the Grand Cross of Finlay. She comments on the recent political unrest in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, August 17, 1953
div1.opener:
QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
August 17, 1953
Dr. Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
It is a long time we do not hear from
you. May be you are in Europe, may be you are in Mars,
who knows these days ... Any way, I will like to know
what are your plans for the winter. I will tell you why:
Ever since that night at the Academia de Ciencias, last
year, I have been thinking I do not like you to walk
behind me, because I am very curious and want to see what
you are doing. I think the only way to solve the problem
is to get you the Gran Cruz de Finlay, so you have to walk
in front of me.

Please tell me if you could fly down to H
Havana por a couple of days to receive it on Dec. 3 Finlay's
Day. We could arrange in time another ceremony at Camp
Lazear.

If you don't mind to suffer the inconve-
niences of an old house “menage”, you could stay at the
Finca, and tell Mary we would not accept any excuse for not
coming with you.

Things have not been very peacefull here
but it seems normality is returning. On account of this
and for personal financial reasons too, we have not been
able to go to Europe this year and had to endure the delights
of heat all summer.
Hoping to hear from you soon,
